reviewText: This box set contains 3 previously released opera DVDs in their original DVD cases, housed in a thin cardboard box. All operas are available on Amazon individually. THE OPERAS ARE: AIDA by Verdi (4.4 stars) 1992 Maria Chiara is Aida. Kristjn Jhannsson is Radams. Dolora Zajick is Amneris. Nello Santi conducts the Orchestra of the Arena di Verona. This is a visual extravaganza on a giant outdoor stage. The singing and acting are mostly excellent. More information and Amazon customer reviews can be found here: Verdi: Aida (Arena Di Verona 1992) (Arthaus Musik: 107253) [DVD] [2012] by Maria Chiara CARMEN by Bizet (4.5 stars) 2003 Marina Domashenko is Carmen. Marco Berti is Don Jos. Maya Dashuk is Michala. Alain Lombard conducts the Orchestra of the Arena di Verona. This is another Arena di Verona spectacle, this time directed by Franco Zeffirelli. More information and Amazon customer reviews can be found here: Bizet - Carmen / Domashenko, Berti, Aceto, Dashuk, Pastorello, Josipovic, Lombard, Verona Opera TOSCA by Puccini (4.4 stars) 2006 Fiorenza Cedolins is Floria Tosca. Marcelo lverez is Mario Cavaradossi. Ruggero Raimondi is Scarpia. Daniel Oren conducts the Orchestra of the Arena di Verona. Fine performances all around. More information and Amazon customer reviews can be found here: Tosca BOX SET DUPLICATIONS: The productions of "Tosca" and "Aida" that appear in this box set also appear in TDK's box set "Arena di Verona". It is here: Opera Exclusive: Arena di Verona - Madama Butterfly/Tosca/Aida The production of "Tosca" that appears in this box set also appears in the box set "Tutto Puccini". It is here: Tutto Puccini - The Complete Giacomo Puccini Opera Edition [Box Set] [Blu-ray] The production of "Tosca" that appears in this box set also appears in the box set "Magic Moments of Opera". It is here: Magic Moments of Opera

In this set, you get three productions, only two of which are really worth seeing. CARMEN and TOSCA are both entertaining, impressively grand productions, bursting with a vitality and energy that mostly compensates for their shortcomings, but this AIDA is a creaky, dull, dated affair.
Because this year I missed the living performances in Verona I have ordered  on DVD them. I was satisfied with the recording itself and the precise delivery by Amazon.
